definition: intact corpse/dead body with no parts missing
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan
person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse
corpse

sentences.english: Not seeking to get out, just leave the whole body.
sentences.chinese: 不求全身而退，只求留有全尸。

sentences.english: It was a full body, with arms and legs.
sentences.chinese: 那是一具全尸，有胳膊有腿。

sentences.english: Listen to your words, died a victim of murder.
sentences.chinese: 听君一席话，死后无全尸。
